website_summaries.verdict: The Audio-Technica ATH-MSR7 is a great-sounding headphone with the one caveat that its sonic detail is so impressive that it brings out both the best and worst in any given source material.
pros: The Audio Technica ATH-MSR7 offers impressive audio quality, is sturdily built, should fit most people comfortably, and comes with three cables, including one that has an inline remote/microphone for cell-phone use
cons: not quite as comfortable as some competing models'
abundance of clarity reveals harshness or distortion in recordings

customer_reviews.title: I received a fake copy. After seeing the individual ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a fake copy. After seeing the individual who bought two versions of it side by side comparison. I noticed the box was of the fake version and trademarks weren’t present.
customer_reviews.author: Celseus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent definition, range, comfort... for audiophiles who prefer smart money, these headphones can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these phones to use instead of a pair of Blue Mo-Fi headphones that while delivering great sound and having an integrated amplifier were a) really uncomfortable to wear over long periods of time and b) are not portable in any real sense. These Audio-Technicas not only surpass the Mo-Fi in terms of comfort and compact storage, but the sonic range and definition is truly amazing. Some of the $1,000-range headphones I've sampled didn't accomplish what this set does. Highly recommend for anyone who needs a high-quality workhorse that you won't require you to take out a loan to own.
customer_reviews.author: B. Myrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent musical headphones for private listening.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very neutral in their sonic signature, which is what I hoped for. Bass is tight and accurate and voices are presented clearly. They are analytical and show the flaws in old recordings, which is ok. Modern recordings, tv, movies are well presented. Noise reduction is good. As they break in they are improving. They are not bass_less as a few reviews allege. Do not have the imaging as good open back headphones, but they do allow for more private listening without as many outside annoyances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds quite awesome with some tweaking and yes the cable matters
customer_reviews.text: Sounds quite awesome with some tweaking and yes the cable matters. Mobile devices use the L cable and for computers use the long straight cable, also do some tweaking in the EQ on the computer by right clicking on the speaker and going to playback devices and then the advanced settings in that and pick what sounds best for you. Also if you have a headphone port on the front of your computer it won't give good power so use the motherboard Jack on the back. They do bring out instruments you've never even heard. I cannot stress this enough if you just listen to badly recorded mp3 tracks then I'd give this set a pass...it exposes bad recording
customer_reviews.author: Ryon

customer_reviews.title: Great paired with tube amp, punches way above class
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Audio Technica's open back headphones and have never been sold on their closed back line, until now. I was looking for more low and midrange support than my open backs, and these fit the bill. These headphones have brilliant response across the full audio spectrum. They lean towards the bright side of the spectrum very indicative of their open line. Connected to my Creative Sound Blaster Dac, or Fulla Schiit II they are a little fatiguing in the highs. Connected to my Monoprice tube amp brings the warmth and turns them into some of the best closed backs I have heard under a grand.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Only one channel at a time
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these headphones last week. The first couldn’t project two channels at once. It seemed like the cable didn’t fit tightly enough into the headphone. You could twist the cable once it was in the headphone and it would switch to the other channel (mostly left to right). So I returned it for another one that had that very same problem. What’s up with that? Is there just a major flaw in the manufacture of these headphones? If so, why isn’t anyone else talking about it online? Anyway, I’ve heard great things about these headphones online. I’d love to be able to hear a pair properly (in stereo).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as studio monitors for my home recording studio. If you are looking for the artificial boost in bass that seems to be desirable by many listeners then look elsewhere. I was looking for a pair with a flat neutral response and that is what I got. Read many reviews for these as well as others and for the price range these seemed to fit the bill and they have. Very happy with my selection and would give it 4 1/2 stars if possible. For non-studio use I run these through a OPPO HA-2SE amp hooked up to a iPod touch or a Sony ZX100 DAP and the headphones sound great for that use as well.
customer_reviews.author: BuckWheat

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my husband and me. We both love these headphones because of the quality of the sound. we have tried a few other brands but now we dont want to try any others. The noise cancelling is excellent. My only complaint is I start feeling nauseous after wearing this for more than an hour, feels very tight fitting on head but he sound balancing is so great that I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: OMG I’m so happy! The sound quality seems extraordinarily neutral & precise
customer_reviews.text: OMG I’m so happy! The sound quality seems extraordinarily neutral & precise, EXACTLY what I was looking for. And I’m hearing sounds & textures that I didn’t hear before.....I’m in my 60’s, I’m not listening to rap or hip-hop, I’m into my generation’s blues, pop, rock. I want to hear natural bass, not enhanced. ( Paul McCartney, Peter Cetera, Chris Squire, even some Enya tracks hit intense vibrating lows). It was a lucky day when I found these, even got a $50 off deal, but worth it to pay even the full price for eargasmic experiences!
customer_reviews.author: Willie John!

customer_reviews.title: A Very good Closed Backed Dynamic Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Nice headphones..Some of the best I've tried. Great for watching TV, not so much for critical music listening. I compared them to my OPPO 2 which are 3 times the price and a different design. (Closed back Dynamic (AT) vs Open back Planar Magnetic (OPPO).) Not a fair comparison. However, the AT are better sounding to me than a pair of Grado's and Focal Spirits that I own. It is also a very comfortable headphone after you break them in. They can be a little tight from the factory. Just bend the upper head band outwards a little or use a basket ball overnight to stretch them a bit.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of headphones if you are looking for pair to take on the airline or use listening to music. These are "noise cancelling" but if you turn the volume real low you can still hear everything around you. There is no perfect noise cancelling headphones, but the sound in this pair is hard to beat. They fit well and are comfortable to wear throughout long flights or listening to music for hours. A friend recommended these headphones are they are comparable to Bose. Overall great sound, decent price, durability, and the comfort cannot be beat by the more expensive headphones on the market.
customer_reviews.author: L.T.

customer_reviews.title: Quality headphone with great resolution, but too harsh and too bass lacking
customer_reviews.text: These are beautifully designed high-resolution headphones, which Audio Technica clearly put a lot of great engineering and quality into. There's a fatal flaw though: the mid-treble response can be harsh and fatiguing with the frequency response produced by most songs. And the bass response is a tad underpowered unfortunately. So I had to return mine. These might work for some people, just not me. If you have any sensitivity to high end harshness, look elsewhere. I ended going with the Sennheiser Momentum 2.0, after returning Bang & Olufsen M6 2nd gen (WAY overrated), Beyerdynamic Custom One Pro, ATH-M5Ox, DT-770 (80 ohm), and this headphone here, the ATH-MSR7.
customer_reviews.author: Praxia

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Clean sound + Pure Bass
customer_reviews.text: Simply its a great headphone for those who seek pure natural sound. I bought it with V-MODA Crossfade M-100, and when I compared both headsets, the V-MODA has too much bass for me and that covered the purity of the sound. The Audio-Technica ATH-MSR7BK has the clean sound and delivers the music the way it should be without boosting anything and yet has the natural bass which you will like ! this is my opinion at least.
customer_reviews.author: Talal Al-Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: Blown away by the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones for $150, and at that price point I am extremely happy with my purchse. I previously have used VModa Crossfade LP, Audio Technica ATH-M40x, Audio Technica ATH-M50x, Shure SE215, as well as a variety of budget headphones. The ATH-MSR7BK SonicPro headphones outperform all of these by a noticeable margin. Listening to music with them is truly an amazing experience. I hear things that I hadn't noticed before in music that I am quite familiar with. Across the spectrum, from bass to high treble, the balance is incredible. Bassheads may not be happy with this, but if you like a well balanced sound, I don't think there is a better option in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Brecht

customer_reviews.title: Plastic headband broke after 18 months; warranty is 12 months
customer_reviews.text: Great balance of sound quality for music and choice. Using a couple hours a day, the ear covers looked quite ragged after a year but were still functional. At about 18 months, the plastic headband broke so the speakers were no longer against one's hears, making them unusable. For $250 headphones the build quality is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headphones - but not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality. Sturdy build. Noise cancelling feature is intentionally mild on these by-design so that sound quality is the same with it turned on or off. But be aware that the active noise cancelling on these does not completely cancel-out background noise. Sound quality is very good, but as other reviews mention, treble/sibilance is very high on these. So, if you are sensitive to that, these headphones can be intense / fatiguing over long listening sessions. If you are looking for something with less treble, the ATH 50s are also excellent.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The bass is not overwhelming and fake sounding like you would hear one some headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones offer a solid build with a solid sound. The bass is not overwhelming and fake sounding like you would hear one some headphones. Rather its a nice kick that doesn't mush up the miss and highs. You can listen to an array of music with these and they all sound good. It comes with different cords which detach from the headset itself. However, the cables are lacking in quality. At least you can detach and replace.
customer_reviews.author: Joey K

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: It has been less than four months, since I have owned these headphones. Unfortunately, about a week ago, I have noticed snapping, crackling, popping, and finally no audio on one side of the headphones. I have also, tried to fix the issue to no avail, i have made sure that the audio jack is fully plugged in, checked that the audio source is on and working, that the audio source is adjusted properly and finally i have tried to alternate cables (which has cost me $10). I am deeply disappointed and saddened that I, no longer, can enjoy music because this mis-advertised poorly made headphones...
customer_reviews.author: Abdulmajeed

customer_reviews.title: I have now had these for 3 1/2 years and I still can't get enough!
customer_reviews.text: I was lucky enough to purchase these in 2017 for $79. Since then, all I've had to do was change the earcups out due to them flaking after 2 1/2 years. Looking back, I should've changed them earlier as I purchased suede ones that are far more comfortable. Other than the earcups, it's the best headset I've ever owned. It is used daily for music, games, and videos. Absolutely crystal clear quality.. This is the way to go if you want to hear music as the artist wanted you to hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Clarity, clarity and clarity
customer_reviews.text: What else do I need to say? There are plenty more qualified reviewer have contributed their nice work. To me personally, it is comfortable to wear. Nice included cable options to choose from. And quality ... For reference, I pair this with Marantz CD 6006 mostly listening to classical, vocal, opera, and occasional 70s and 80s pops. As expected, it beats out my 26 years old Sony MDR-V6 easily.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Noise Cancel, not comfortable on (my) head
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are exactly as advertised and rated for noise-cancelling, they are incredible in sound quality too! I, however, have a problem with how they "rest" on the top of my head... leaving me with a headache after every flight. It could be my head ;) it could be the way they rest, who knows - but for me, comfort is key and almost outweighs sound quality. It has nothing to do the with the product as advertised, they simply do not rest / fit my head the way I had hoped. [I tested them out on multiple international flights in January and February]
customer_reviews.author: Megan Holmstrom

customer_reviews.title: Extremely uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: So uncomfortable! I wanted to buy a good pair of Audio Technica headphones because of all the praise they get about audio quality. And it is good. BUT IT IS SO UNCOMFORTABLE! the top part puts a lot of pressure on my head and it gets uncomfortable really quick. I have the bose quiet comfort 15, and... it's no contest. I would like to return them if I could. It hurt to pay that much for something that I really don't want to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Aorata

customer_reviews.title: Out of this world, top notch
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. It's about better than the ath m50s. It isn't muddy like the m50s and has a really clear crisp sound. Before I bought it, I read many comments about how it can be tough listening to, and how it can produce good quality, but you might not have as a relaxing experience with it. Well I disagree, not only do I think it blows the ath M50s out of the water, I think it can make music even more relaxing, as I have fallen asleep a few times wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Note: This is my first pair of "Hi-Fi" headphones. That being said these sounds fantastic. They've got a rigid build quality and a decent selection of cables for your phone/pc/studio. The only complaint I have however is the clamping force around the head. After a while you start to feel pressure and have to take them off. It's a minor issue and can be remidied somewhat with softer ear cups. All in all a great pair of headphones that I can recommend to anyone, bearing in mind of the clamping force.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my elderly father who enjoys listening to classical Indian music- much to the chagrin of my mother. He usually takes his hearing aids out and cranks up the volume on YouTube (yeah, we know). Mom suggested these as an alternative to listening- and he was game. The over-the-ear style was preferable to the ear buds- sometimes ear buds get uncomfortable and just dont fit right. I did a trial run with these alternating classical, EDM, hip-hop, acoustic guitar, and a bit of Indian-style. I'm no audiophile like some of these other reviewers, but I think they sounded great!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Pretty basic set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am not disappointed with this product but there is nothing to get too excited about either. There is no real richness to the sound quality for example. These are NOT noise canceling headphones by any means though they do a fairly good job of blocking out airplane noise. I might expect to pay under $100 for the quality I got with these headphones. Meh
customer_reviews.author: Doug Jacke

customer_reviews.title: Nice, effective, heavy
customer_reviews.text: Cuts out a lot of the background noise. I share a computer den with others, definitely deadens button-slapping, keyboard noises, and voices. You can still hear anyone talking directly to you, but they have to repeat themselves. :) I went from being very frustrated with my roommates to being able to share a room with both of them in peace. The primary downside is they are not very comfortable for extended use. I have to adjust them because of the pressure on my head fairly often.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a pair of bass heavy headphones I would check out the m50x's.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, however I rate them three out of five stars because the noise cancelling is poor compared to newer models and other brands, plus the aluminum backing is nice but it does not help with noise. Not bass heavy, but it is not absent. If I could have known anything about these headphones before I bought them, It would be that if you switch from a pair of bass heavy headphones they take getting used to. Audio Technica really puts out good products and I love their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: Prominent deep bass and a lively treble brings out the best from my album and CD collections. I was worried the sound wouldn’t be as accurate as my old PSB M4U, but the ATH-MSR7NC has incredible clarity and detail. The PSBs were very comfortable, but the Audio Technica is comparable; very comfy, even after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Runvet

customer_reviews.title: NO BASS AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Audio Technica make some nice headphones...Unfortunately these are the worst ones they make. They have an extremely bright signature. Bass what bass. The magnets are not Neodynium = NO BASS. Also, the pair I got from Amazon warehouse deals were not like new. At best Very Good. Warehouse deals are getting worse.
customer_reviews.author: lanmo

customer_reviews.title: I bought them specifically so that she "won't have to listen to her annoying roommate. " So far they're super effective
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my girlfriend. She loves them. I bought them specifically so that she "won't have to listen to her annoying roommate." So far they're super effective. Additionally, they work so well that she can't hear the fire alarm when it goes off -- which in actuality might be a bad thing. The sound quality is great, as well as the looks. The only real downside is that my girlfriend has a terrible taste in music, so it's unfortunate the cans will never really play the music something of this high quality deserves to play
customer_reviews.author: Jamie K.

customer_reviews.title: ... pair of these on eBay and they sound absolutely fantastic..
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a pair of these on eBay and they sound absolutely fantastic.... Very very clear.....with all genres.... Everything is well balanced.... No overbearing base but very good base and sound separation.... I can clearly hear the beat, details, voice and samples in music when I am just holding the headphones arm's length in front of me.....good is too....we'll worth money......unlike other headphones like beats that are more focused on looks and not sound quality..... These are also great looking and quite sturdy....big thumbs up!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: coolvee

customer_reviews.title: Earpads falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for a few years now and I have to say that the earpads do not hold up well. The material is flaking off the ear pads. The sound quality is decent if you like flat sound. They do not add bass at all. You will hear a lot of detail in the tracks that you listen to.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewL

customer_reviews.title: Top quality headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are top quality for wired connections. Note that this headphone set is not designed with Bluetooth. For wired connections in a noisy environment, these cannot be beat! The internal battery (for noise cancelling) is rechargeable, and can last up to about 30 hours of use before needing to be recharged.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M.

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable. Comfort is 'eh'.
customer_reviews.text: They sounded pretty great, powered alongside a Schiit Fulla 2 DAC/amp, but ultimately I returned them just because of the comfort. They're basically as snug and hard pressed on your ears much like the ATH-M50x's are, but just a tid-bit looser. I gave them about three weeks to break in on my head but I couldn't really do it. Your mileage may vary, but they do sound nice and the bass isn't crazy overpowering; kinda' only there when it's necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Tennaki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gear for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Pros:- 1) Clarity sound - Crispy clear, balance but mild bassy 2) Good ANC - Frequently used on the road, subway and flight 3) Very well build and quality - steel on panel and rest plastic 4) USB cable charge and power consumption seems pretty less since being used alot and never drains out. 4) Reasonable price - For this price with above points Cons:- 1) Cant wear long hours, feels getting tight - Not as comfortable as Momentum 2) Build not as good as Momentum 2) ANC not as good as QC25 3) Some creaking sound while pulling in/out 4) Travelling on the bumpy road better to use in-ear phone instead 5) Take some space on backpack
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: I like these phones
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Warm sounding cans and easy to wear. I have to adjust fit some but I use them while moving around. When paired with fiio e17 dac/amp they sound really good. Hard for me to rate high end sound as I fried my ears years ago and have trouble with treble setting. Much more comfortable that vmoda 100's. I do listen very intently and "welcome to the pleasure dome" will so you how good they are.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is not loud enough for my liking.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the sound volume of these headphones. Turned volume up all the way on my phone and it isn't loud enough. For the price of this product, I expected more. Bass and treble sound quality is good. Isn't listed to be noise canceling and it isn't. I would NOT recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: gator1fan

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible headphones that work well with cellphone for making calls too
customer_reviews.text: A pleasant surprise was the inline microphone that makes these very good for making cellphone calls. I was hoping for a little more stand alone noise cancelling, but they do a good job of muting the noise. Excellent sound when used to listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Breyfogle

customer_reviews.title: NC almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Battery last very long, NC almost perfect but not as good as Bose's, sound quality is great and build quality is good after many harsh use, comfortable after long hours, cables are good quality, recommended if you can pay the price for these.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar U.

customer_reviews.title: I love the sound it produces
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound it produces, its perfect for jazz type music. I would not recommend for bass lovers looking to get a lot of bass. From a scale of 1-10 I would rate it a 4 on the bass scale.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: These do a great job of cancelling noise
customer_reviews.text: I recently had to move out of my office and back in the living room where everyone watches TV. I work from home a fair amount and I am learning how to play an digital piano. I was very worried that I would not be able to make it work until I bought these headphones. They are very effective at blocking out noise.
customer_reviews.author: George S Norris

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound. One of the cords arrived damaged which affects sound. Contacted seller for replacement. Otherwise, the item appears to be solid and good quality. Sound could be a bit more detailed. Will see how the performance and NC is over time and frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: MBT fan

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but people can easily hear what you hear.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. they are insanely well built and are very tough to break. bass is a little low but the mids are fantastic, the lows are crisp, and just overall very good sound quality. However, there is no seclusion here. sure they block the noise just fine, but anyone within 10 feet of you can hear what your listening too very easily and i don't particularly like that.
customer_reviews.author: RagikiTomi

customer_reviews.title: Five star. Excellent
customer_reviews.text: it delivers excellent crisp sounds. I don’t usually do reviews but this device deserves the best compliment, I am really happy for this investment. This an an excellent product...
customer_reviews.author: Missy Tirs

customer_reviews.title: The are perfectly comfortable for about two hours
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I have not heard music any clearer than through these headphones. The are perfectly comfortable for about two hours, then start to feel a little heavy. I also love the vintage appearance to them, and color scheme. But the important part is the sound.
customer_reviews.author: HouseofG

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is awesome
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is really really awesome, it is very clear. Noise cancellation is good. The construction materials are of the best quality, they look really good. I do not like that the cables are very short (2 x 1.2 meters), it would be very useful to bring one of greater length (ie: for use in the recording studio). In general it is a product that is very worthwhile. Was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M Leal

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am not a audiophile to say the least but these headphones are truly worth the money. If you like deep powerful bass these headphones may not be the ones for you. The sounds are rich ,crisp and clear. The bass is balanced and you can actually hear horns and strings the way they were meant to be heard. I recommend these to people that just enjoy music and want to have a great time listening.
customer_reviews.author: voodoo40

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about this. I think the only thing I would want from it is a bag that closes with a zipper, not a draw string. Other than that they are comfortable, durable, looks good, and sound amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hanselman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Love it! With all the details, still cannot be used for monitoring though. It kinda makes everything sound very good. That's a positive and a negative.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great set of headphones, upper mids a little too high maybe so these can be very abrasive at times and it has a very sibilant "S" on a lot of songs so thats a downer, the comfort is pretty good after you stretch them a bit to get rid of the clamp, the design is beautiful , cables are fine, not that premium but fine, the UN-packaging is great if you wanna gift these and maybe they can get sweaty if you go outside with a very hot weather
customer_reviews.author: Jubella

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones for the price, even if you aren't an audiophile. Very clear and crisp sounds. Unlike the M50 I has previously it doesn't have a proprietary 3.5mm connector on the headphones
customer_reviews.author: D. Costanza

customer_reviews.title: Minimal Noise Canceling
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my Audio-Techna headphones, without noise canceling functionality, the difference was noticeable, but didn't meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Tomsick

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price if bought used.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are creaky, cable is short, battery life isn't that long, ear pads are uncomfortable. sound quality isn't amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Riverdener

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very nice. I used it when I was doing homework. And noise prevention。
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Noise Canceling and packaging seemed out of sorts
customer_reviews.text: Noise Canceling didn't appear to be up to par with other identical headphones purchased. Sent in package too small. Headphones also seemed worn (headband loose, ear pads dented, packaging creased. From receiving to opening, it was pretty easy to determine I'd need a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Fahle

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! They sound great and they feel VERY comfortable. They're not as bassy as some other headphones.. but I like more realistic sound of these bad boys.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Matches what I have read on headset sites.
customer_reviews.text: I like my sets to be snug and this one fits the bill. Clear sound. Feels like singer right there. No muddy mids so no base drone. Light on the base actually. So if you at looking for base, you probably will skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Did not include manual, USB cable or Airline adapter. Missing parts or used/serviced Headphones (I'll never know?)
customer_reviews.author: PPGabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a couple months now and they have been treating me great. They are nice and comfortable even for long use and with a nice tension on the head. The weight is perfect and the size is nice. I have large ears and these ear cuffs, even small, don't put pressure on them. The sound quality is fantastic for this price, especially if you manage to get a pair of these on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Will L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy those!
customer_reviews.text: Got those on August 31st, ​2016 - so now it's a year and a half of regular, in-house use and they are falling apart. Another thing - those are too tight and will block blood flow - after 2h in headphones, I feel horrible pain in ears - not to mention black pieces of material all over my head. So disappointed in those. Time to go back to good old Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace my ath-m50's. They are more comfortable around the ears. They work great. I thought I read they came with a curled cord but they didn't. 3 different length straight cords. Work great and I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ear Cup SNAPPED OFF
customer_reviews.text: After only 4 months of daily use, I went to put it on normally, and it SNAPPED. TOO LATE TO RETURN. DO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU LIKE WASTING MONEY. POOR QUALITY PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Darren S.

customer_reviews.title: Received these headphones and they are absolutely fantastic. Cons
customer_reviews.text: Received these headphones and they are absolutely fantastic. Cons: -Comfort level is a little lacking with a hot spot on the top of the head after about an hour of listening, but its not bad enough to cause pain or major discomfort. Pros: -Sound is incredible, if you are an absolute bass head I would not recommend these to you. Highs are amazing and the mids are front and center. Bass is there and you can hear everything with amazing accuracy but you are not going to be rattling your skull with them For $250 its going to be hard to find a better pair of closed back headphones at the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C.

customer_reviews.title: It's like listening to all my songs for the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of higher end headphones and it's so worth it! It's like listening to all my songs for the first time again! These are definitely going to be a favorite pair for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: CalebKat

customer_reviews.title: Great headset!
customer_reviews.text: I checked numerous online reviews. All were good. Headset is great.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon B

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation, 24+ hours battery, amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for audio playback of both video and audio, mainly YouTube and spotify, respectively. The noise cancellation is pretty good, and lasts well over 24 hours after fully charging the headphones. The sound quality us very good, and the bass isn't over exaggerated.
customer_reviews.author: Aggelos Zymaris

customer_reviews.title: These headphones sound great. I read some reviews that mentioned the hinges ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great. I read some reviews that mentioned the hinges creaking but I haven't had that happen at all. The earcups seemed a little shallow and I was worried they would grow uncomfortable when using them for too long but after wearing them for nearly 3 hours straight I can say they are really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo van Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Old tech. Slightly disappointing design and performance.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Not really worth it. Noise canceling is decent but not great. Has a micro USB instead of type C (this model is older, so this isn't too surprising). Just felt clunky and old - Like I know I was holding something considered high tech 12 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: A nice pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: A nice pair of headphones. Feels slightly too tight on the ears after a while though. Even worse for me because I wear glasses. And if not positioned properly, the ears feel hot and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Actually the first set of headsets I have owned, so I do not really have anything to compare it to. But I am satisfied with the sound quality and comfort of the headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: The husband loves them- replacing Bose headphones about 8-9 years old. He says they are a great value
customer_reviews.author: Very Picky Shopper

customer_reviews.title: An excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: They did not artificially "enhance" the sound of the music like others do. It sounds like you're listening to live music. Noise cancelling is not great, but the sound is superb, and the price is terrific. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anihu

customer_reviews.title: Really good sound and noise canceling.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Really effective noise canceling. Great for flying and for in-flight entertainment systems. Only downside is they don't have Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Nix

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, a bit hot and the glue on the side that holds the brand symbol broke apart day 1
customer_reviews.text: Day 1, the brand on the side of the headphone was already off when it arrived. Dried Glue only- no brand symbol on one side.
customer_reviews.author: Wael Salloum

customer_reviews.title: Barely better than earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointing. The noise cancelling did next to nothing on a recent transcontinental flight. At home, The noise cancelling introduced a pulsing noise when seated close to a portable fan. They don't have the warm sound that I prefer. Poor bass for the size of the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: The Git

customer_reviews.title: Very good build quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good build quality, a little better than average comfort, great sound quality but you can't put the volume too high or the treble may hurt your ears. Sound isolation is ok but you can usually hear other people around unless your volume is really high up. Overall, very pleased with purchase because the sound is so clear and exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality, premium build and modestly price. If you are thinking about getting headphones (for portable use / closed back) these are highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT headphones! Very comfortable. Excellent bass and all around sound.
customer_reviews.author: vanman

customer_reviews.title: but he's gone through quite a few and said these are the best pair he's ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend loves them. I'm no headphone expert, but he's gone through quite a few and said these are the best pair he's ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Senga15

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT over-the-ear (circumaural) cans - they are on-ear
customer_reviews.text: These ate NOT over-the-ear (circumaural) cans - they are on-ear - unless your ears are the size of a toddler's
customer_reviews.author: nova

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and absolutely love them! I thought my previous headphones were good but these blow the sound quality out of the water!
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great and Reliable! Sound quality is top notch. Noise canceller isn't sooo good as Bose's, but still very good.
customer_reviews.author: Mozartt Zeni

customer_reviews.title: Fit and feel were great. Clarity is excellent and the selection of cords ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit and feel were great. Clarity is excellent and the selection of cords to meet specific needs is a nice touch. I've also been complimented on how these headphones look. Used to be a dedicated Klipsch faithful, but these have definitely converted me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Banks

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely one of the best
customer_reviews.text: For the money, these see one of the best headphones ever made. We've had several others and when our last pair fell in an unusual way and broke the earpiece off, we had to get another pair. We use it daily for everything.
customer_reviews.author: CPA Sam

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful sound quality fits well and comes with more cords than you'll need. You just may need to buy a mic for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Adam DiVecchio

customer_reviews.title: Good for lectures
customer_reviews.text: I use these to listen to medical school lectures. They are great.
customer_reviews.author: TP11

customer_reviews.title: I went to these from Koss R-80s Yea VAST improvement ...
customer_reviews.text: I went to these from Koss R-80s Yea VAST improvement. Reminds me of listing to my dads big ass Curtis Mathes half block long stereo. I didn't know my laptop could reproduce such highs and lows. sorry Im rocking out and happy
customer_reviews.author: D T Morgan

customer_reviews.title: No annoying muffled bass booms
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. HR 3 of burn in - here are my notes to date: 1) I'm in awe of the clarity. A bigger soundstage, hearing buts I have not heard before as I cycle through parts of my collection. 2) crisp highs, solid mid- range. No cymbal fatigue at all here. 3) highly defined bass. No annoying muffled bass booms. Just clear storks or be heard.
customer_reviews.author: blue

customer_reviews.title: Totally ineffective Noise Canceling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: without a doubt, NOT worth the money - at all! Totally ineffective at canceling noise and the audio quality is "okay".
customer_reviews.author: Mary G.

customer_reviews.title: Crisp sound plus good insulation from bakground noise
customer_reviews.text: The headphones provide a good blend of crisp sounds. They fit comfortably around your ears. You have good insulation from background noise.
customer_reviews.author: C-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what an amazing headphone!
customer_reviews.text: Really fantastic, flat, studio quality sound for people that want to hear the music, as it was intended. People who like the over saturated bass won't want these. They fit great for the most part. Love the look, also. Great headphone!!
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Headphones are great.
customer_reviews.text: Because I can't test all headphone models, I went with a Consumer Reports recommendation that I could afford and that were not in-ear phones, because I wear hearing aids. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good value headphones but tilted towards the high frequencies
customer_reviews.text: The highs are very clear and extended. Doesn’t sound shrill. But overall sound balance is not to my liking. Bass is present but the sound signature is tilted towards the highs.
customer_reviews.author: B.Nair

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are awesome. Charged them up and the noise cancelling feature ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are awesome. Charged them up and the noise cancelling feature works great. The tones are more lifelike and sounds like in an isolation room and playing the songs, great sound.
customer_reviews.author: John Lange

customer_reviews.title: Nice look. Little big update compare to m50x
customer_reviews.text: High Quality sound and fabrication.Portable. Nice look. Little big update compare to m50x. Highly recommended for audio lovers
customer_reviews.author: Gadiel

customer_reviews.title: Leather fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on May 3, 2106 from Amazon. Leather has rotted away. I listen for maybe a 1/2 hour a day. No sweating. This should not happen. I would like a replacement pair. Jim@jamesandersoncpa.com
customer_reviews.author: James D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Sound is very good, cords are high enough quality for me
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very good, cords are high enough quality for me. Comfortable. Only not 5 stars because it's probably not the best possible set, but deserves 5 stars in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: foolish bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Hi Res lover and Price Right
customer_reviews.text: If you like the Audio Technica signature sound, you won't disappointed. It gives good detail, stage, and vocal. The only con is for my big head is kind of too tight that I need to physically adjust the band. Recommended A+++
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised. It was meant as a birthday present and I was told of its great quality in build, appearance, comfort, and sound. Arrived earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Jimenez

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica ATH-MSR7BK SonicPro Over-Ear High-Resolution Audio Headphones, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:Black-Newly designed 45 mm True Motion Drivers deliver Hi-Res Audio reproduction
-Multi-layer Air Damping Technology
-Ultra-comfortable, soft, memory foam ear pads and headband
-Three detachable cables
-Stainless steel acoustic mesh resistor
feature_bullets: Designed to reproduce Hi-Res Audio, allowing you to hear your music the way it was intended
Exclusive 45 mm True Motion Drivers improve transient response and minimize sound distortion for rich, detailed audio reproduction
Features multi-layered air damping technology for extended mid-to-low frequency response
Housings constructed of an aluminum/magnesium mix provide a lightweight, rigid structure that reduce unwanted resonance
Three precisely placed vents within the layers work to control air flow and improve dynamics
Highly flexible swivel design, with soft, memory foam earpads and headband ensure comfort even during long listening sessions
Stainless steel acoustic mesh resistor provides improved high-frequency response, while bass acoustic resistor delivers accurate low-frequency response

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,167 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
